name: Hartlepool United FC History Quiz | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1908.

	The club also adopted Victoria Park as their home ground this year, and were originally named Hatlepools United until 1968, when they were renamed as just Hartlepool, and in 1977 they became Hartlepool United.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Alfred Priest.

	Priest was manager between 1908-12, followed by Humphreys for one season, Manners (1913-20), and Potter between 1920-22.

questions.text: Which of these four made more League appearances for the club?
questions.explanation:
Wattie Moore.

	Moore played in 447 League games for the club between 1948-64.

questions.text: In which season did the club first enter the Football League?
questions.explanation:
1921-22.

	Hartlepools United (as they were known as then), finished 4th out of 20 teams in the 1921-22 Division Three (North) season, with 42 points from 38 games.

questions.text: Which of these set a record for the youngest person to play for the club?
questions.explanation:
John McGovern.

	McGovern set the record on 21st May, 1966 when he played against Bradford City at the age of 16 years and 205 days.

questions.text: Where did the club sign Eifion Williams from in 2002?
questions.explanation:
Torquay United.

	Williams began his career at Barry Town in 1998, and was signed by Torquay one season later. He signed for Hartlepool on 6th March, 2002.

questions.text: Which of these scored the most League goals for the club?
questions.explanation:
Ken Johnson.

	Johnson scored 98 League goals for the club betweem 1949-64.

The Monkey Hangers.

	They got this name in strange fashion. A French ship, the "Chasse Marree" come aground on the coast of Hartlepool during the Napoleonic war. No survivors were onboard, apart from one monkey, dressed in French uniform. The locals, having never seen a Frenchman, thought the monkey was a spy, and sentenced it to death by hanging it from the mast of a shipping boat!

questions.text: Who did the club beat in 1959 to set a record for their biggest League victory?
questions.explanation:
Barrow.

	Hartlepool won the game 10-1 on 4th April, 1959, in a Division Four game.

questions.text: Who were the club playing when they gained the biggest attendance of the 20th century at Victoria Park?
questions.explanation:
Manchester United.

	17,426 people attended the FA Cup 5th round game against United on 5th January 1957.
